channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: From cubicles to kitchens: How empty offices are becoming homes
item.description: Many U.S. cities have too many office buildings and not enough homes. Developers are now converting some old offices into apartments and condos, but it's going slowly.
item.content:encoded:
Many U.S. cities have too many office buildings and not enough homes. Developers are now converting some old offices into apartments and condos, but it's going slowly.

(Image credit: Valerie Plesch for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Eleana Tworek

item.title: Opinion: The enduring dignity of Jesse Jackson
item.description: Rev. Jesse Jackson died this week at age 84. NPR's Scott Simon remembers covering Jackson's 1984 presidential campaign in Mississippi.
item.content:encoded:
Rev. Jesse Jackson died this week at age 84. NPR's Scott Simon remembers covering Jackson's 1984 presidential campaign in Mississippi.

(Image credit: Tannen Maury/ASSOCIATED PRESS)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: 'Given a gun and sent to die': Kenyans lured to fight for Russia in Ukraine
item.description: Kenya's intelligence service warns that over 1,000 citizens may have been recruited to fight for Russia in Ukraine, many under false pretenses.
item.content:encoded:
Kenya's intelligence service warns that over 1,000 citizens may have been recruited to fight for Russia in Ukraine, many under false pretenses.

(Image credit: Simon Maina)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Igunza

item.title: Trump throws a temper tantrum after tariff loss
item.description: The battle over the tariffs began on day one of the president's second term when he signed an executive order that let him impose a wide range of tariffs on virtually every U.S. trading partner.
item.content:encoded:
The battle over the tariffs began on day one of the president's second term when he signed an executive order that let him impose a wide range of tariffs on virtually every U.S. trading partner.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: With U.S. forces in position, Trump mulls his options for Iran
item.description: President Trump says he hasn't decided whether to attack Iran. While he weighs his options, a military buildup over the past month means the U.S. now has an expansive presence in the region.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he hasn't decided whether to attack Iran. While he weighs his options, a military buildup over the past month means the U.S. now has an expansive presence in the region.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Stop picking at your cuticles! 7 ways to keep your nails healthy and strong
item.description: Should you trim your cuticles? How do you cut a hangnail? Is it better to use a cardboard or crystal file? Dermatologists and a nail technician share basic nail health tips.
item.content:encoded:
Should you trim your cuticles? How do you cut a hangnail? Is it better to use a cardboard or crystal file? Dermatologists and a nail technician share basic nail health tips.

(Image credit: bee_photobee/ Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Former top general calls military's removal of trans troops a costly mistake
item.description: As several global tensions simmer, the Pentagon is removing thousands of transgender troops under an anti-DEI push. How might a focus on gender identity distract from mission readiness?
item.content:encoded:
'/>

As several global tensions simmer, the Pentagon is removing thousands of transgender troops under an anti-DEI push. How might a focus on gender identity distract from mission readiness?

(Image credit: Jackie Lay/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hodges

item.title: After the Supreme Court's ruling on tariffs, companies line up for refunds
item.description: The Supreme Court on Friday struck down President Trump's tariffs. But the justices left a $133 billion question unanswered: What's going to happen to the money the government has already collected?
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court on Friday struck down President Trump's tariffs. But the justices left a $133 billion question unanswered: What's going to happen to the money the government has already collected?

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In Berlin, there are movies, there's politics and there's talk about it all
item.description: Buzz around whether the city's film festival would take a stance on the war in Gaza has dominated conversation in recent days.
item.content:encoded:
Buzz around whether the city's film festival would take a stance on the war in Gaza has dominated conversation in recent days.

(Image credit: John MacDougall)
item.dc:creator: Teresa Xie

item.title: Aerial skiers win 11th gold medal for Team USA, a new Winter Olympics record for America
item.description: U.S. freestyle skiers  clinch an eleventh gold medal for Team USA in mixed team aerials,surpassing the U.S.'s all-time record for gold medals in a Winter Olympics.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. freestyle skiers  clinch an eleventh gold medal for Team USA in mixed team aerials,surpassing the U.S.'s all-time record for gold medals in a Winter Olympics.

(Image credit: Patrick Smith)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang
